API details
info:
###### *What is this?*

This node will create a RESTful API that can
be used as a pre-registration action to validate
appliance metadata.

---

###### *How do I use it?*

In your IoT for Electronics dashboard,
you should see a section called
**"Configure Appliance Registration"**.
Configure the *Pre-registration* fields with
the following information:

- **Method:** POST  
- **URL:** https://<your_app_name>.mybluemix.net/api/validate

**_Note:_** This API is not protected, so you
can leave the **_username_** and **_password_**
fields blank.

---

###### *What now?*

When you are registering an appliance,
a validation action will be triggered prior
to the registration process. It will get the
appliance metadata from Watson IoT Platform
and will compare to the values you defined in
the response object (see
**_Customize validations_** node for more info).

If all the attributes are successfully
validated, then the registration process
continues. If any of the given attributes
fails during validation, the registration
process is aborted.

name: Customize validations
info:
###### Description

When registering a single appliance
you can use specific attributes to validade,
such as _Serial Number_, or _Appliance ID_.

If you are registering multiples appliance at
once, the validations defined here will be
performed for every appliance, so it makes sense
to validate more generic attributes, such as
_Appliance Type_, or _Model_.

---

###### Getting the appliance data

The appliance information that was initially
sent to the registration process will be passed
along to this node in the **request body**, as
a **_JSON object_**. It will looks like
something like this:

```
{
    "userID": "john",
    "applianceID": "MY_APPLIANCE"
    "applianceDetail": {
        // custom metadata
    }
}
```
**_Note:_** If you are registering multiple
appliances at once, you will receive an
**_array of objects_** in the **request body**.

---

###### Formatting the response

With the appliance information, you will be
able to define what attributes you want to
validate and format your response. You must
send a **_JSON object_** in the following
format:

```
{
    "validate": {
        "deviceInfo": {
            // attributes keys and values
        }
    }
}
```

name: Response object
API details
info:
###### *What is this?*

This node will create a RESTful API that can
be used as a post-registration action to send
a command to the devices after registration.

---

###### *How do I use it?*

In your IoT for Electronics dashboard,
you should see a section called
**"Configure Appliance Registration"**.
Configure the *Post-registration* fields with
the following information:

- **Method:** POST  
- **URL:** https://<your_app_name>.mybluemix.net/api/sendCommand

**_Note:_** This API is not protected, so you
can leave the **_username_** and **_password_**
fields blank.

---

###### *What now?*

After the registration process, a command
will be sent using the MQTT protocol to all the
appliances that were successfully registered
(see **_Command details_** node for more
info).

name: Command details
info:
###### Description

To send a command to the appliances that were
successfully registered, you need to send a
**_JSON object_** in the **response body** using
the following format:

```
{
    "command": {
        "commandId": <command name>,
        "command": <payload message>
    }
}
```

**_Note:_** The payload is optional. Use it only
if needed.

name: Response object
Notification flow
info:
###### *What is this?*

This flow is triggered by a specific 
change in appliance status (such as a failure).
The type of change that can trigger 
the flow is defined by a rule that is 
created in IoT Platform. The flow uses 
IoT for Electronics APIs to identify the 
owner of the appliance and the owner's email. 
It then generates and sends an email 
notification with the following information:
information:
- **DeviceID** 
- **Time of action triggered**
- **Event type**
- **Device type**

---
